channel.title: Operating systems?
channel.description:
You can also post the version of operating system... e.g Ubuntu or Win7.. (Don't flame, I just want to know what people are using)
Honestly, I dual boot Windows 7 and Ubuntu 12.04.1... Thinking about switching to Ubuntu for main operating system.

item.title: Operating systems?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

gentoo and windows 7

Read full topic

item.title: Operating systems?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I put linux because I can’t select windows and linux

I only use windows but if several proprietary programs and games I use could be ran on linux natively I’d switch to using linux in a heartbeat

RandQm:

There is more and more activity in the virus branche towards linux due it’s increasing popularity.

linux is ‘virus free’ in the sense that due to the design of the system, even if you get a virus it can do very little damage without permissions from the user, something windows hasn’t had until at least windows vista, but unlike windows linux is incredibly easy to set up in a secure fashion making it virtually impossible to suffer any ill effects from a virus without significant human error involved

at the end of the day, linux is very much ‘virus proof’ compared to windows 7 but either system can be compromised due to human error at varying levels, linux happens to require more user error than windows

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

I’m currently with Windows 7 Ultimate x64. I used to dual-boot with Ubuntu. For some reason I loved to use Ubuntu more but it couldn’t handle RS very great and almost no software was meeting my requirements comparing to the Windows one. So yeah Windows FTW!

item.title: Operating systems?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Nebulae, post:33, topic:459813”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=562716.msg4102860#msg4102860 date=1347691067]

Well if I may be honest I never really tried. I just had 6 installed and never updated so the inclination to update wasn’t there. I Googled it once when I got the xstream runtime error that was due to outdated libs, but I didn’t get very far because I had no idea what I was looking for.

I have since had a fresh install and am currently using the latest 7 version of Java. I know about compiling in 7 to get it to run in 7 first, but usually I use a PJA or Shard and they just worked with version 6, so I stuck with it.

hurrr durr environment variables.
[/quote]
I know how to update my environment variables, but that still didn’t solve the fact that my xstream was out dated.[/quote]

I guess the first step in getting a newer xsteam library is to maybe download it? :eek:

Read full topic
